draft-urn-ogf.txt: draft-urn-ogf.xml


  		





  
  4
  
    
	xml2rfc draft-urn-ogf


  		





  
  5
  
    

  		





  
  6
  
    
draft-urn-ogf.html: draft-urn-ogf.xml


  		





  
  7
  
    
	xsltproc draft-urn-ogf.xml > draft-urn-ogf.html

</style><link rel="Contents" href="#rfc.toc"><link rel="Author" href="#rfc.authors"><link rel="Copyright" href="#rfc.copyright"><link rel="Chapter" title="1 Introduction" href="#rfc.section.1"><link rel="Chapter" title='2 URN Specification for "ogf" NID' href="#rfc.section.2"><link rel="Chapter" title="3 Examples (Informative)" href="#rfc.section.3"><link rel="Chapter" title="4 Namespace Considerations" href="#rfc.section.4"><link rel="Chapter" title="5 Community Considerations" href="#rfc.section.5"><link rel="Chapter" title="6 Security Considerations" href="#rfc.section.6"><link rel="Chapter" title="7 IANA Considerations" href="#rfc.section.7"><link rel="Chapter" title="8 Acknowledgements" href="#rfc.section.8"><link rel="Chapter" href="#rfc.section.9" title="9 References"><meta name="generator" content="http://greenbytes.de/tech/webdav/rfc2629.xslt, Revision 1.470, 2009-09-22 21:35:53, XSLT vendor: libxslt http://xmlsoft.org/XSLT/"><meta name="keywords" content="urn, ogf"><link rel="schema.DC" href="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"><meta name="DC.Creator" content="Dijkstra, F."><meta name="DC.Creator" content="Hughes-Jones, R."><meta name="DC.Identifier" content="urn:ietf:id:draft-dijkstra-urn-ogf"><meta name="DC.Date.Issued" scheme="ISO8601" content="2010-11-08"><meta name="DC.Description.Abstract" content="This document describes a URN (Uniform Resource Name) namespace that is engineered by the Open Grid Forum (OGF) for naming persistent resources."><meta name="description" content="This document describes a URN (Uniform Resource Name) namespace that is engineered by the Open Grid Forum (OGF) for naming persistent resources."></head><body><table class="header" border="0" cellpadding="1" cellspacing="1"><tr><td class="header left">Network Working Group</td><td class="header right">F. Dijkstra</td></tr><tr><td class="header left">Internet Draft</td><td class="header right">SARA</td></tr><tr><td class="header left">


  		





  
  291
  
    
        &lt;draft-dijkstra-urn-ogf&gt;


  		





  
  292
  
    
      </td><td class="header right">R. Hughes-Jones</td></tr><tr><td class="header left">Intended status: Informational</td><td class="header right">DANTE</td></tr><tr><td class="header left">Expires: May 12, 2011</td><td class="header right">November 8, 2010</td></tr></table><p class="title">A URN Namespace for the Open Grid Forum (OGF)<br><span class="filename">draft-dijkstra-urn-ogf</span></p><h1 id="rfc.abstract"><a href="#rfc.abstract">Abstract</a></h1> <p>This document describes a URN (Uniform Resource Name) namespace that is engineered by the Open Grid Forum (OGF) for naming persistent resources.</p> <h1><a id="rfc.status" href="#rfc.status">Status of this Memo</a></h1><p>This Internet-Draft is submitted to IETF in full conformance with the provisions of BCP 78 and BCP 79.</p><p>Internet-Drafts are working documents of the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF), its areas, and its working groups. Note that other groups may also distribute working documents as Internet-Drafts.</p><p>Internet-Drafts are draft documents valid for a maximum of six months and may be updated, replaced, or obsoleted by other documents at any time. It is inappropriate to use Internet-Drafts as reference material or to cite them other than as &#8220;work in progress&#8221;.</p><p>The list of current Internet-Drafts can be accessed at &lt;<a href="http://www.ietf.org/ietf/1id-abstracts.txt">http://www.ietf.org/ietf/1id-abstracts.txt</a>&gt;.</p><p>The list of Internet-Draft Shadow Directories can be accessed at &lt;<a href="http://www.ietf.org/shadow.html">http://www.ietf.org/shadow.html</a>&gt;.</p><p>This Internet-Draft will expire in May 12, 2011.</p><h1><a id="rfc.copyrightnotice" href="#rfc.copyrightnotice">Copyright Notice</a></h1><p>Copyright ? 2010 IETF Trust and the persons identified as the document authors. All rights reserved.</p><p>This document is subject to BCP 78 and the IETF Trust's Legal Provisions Relating to IETF Documents (<a href="http://trustee.ietf.org/license-info">http://trustee.ietf.org/license-info</a>) in effect on the date of publication of this document. Please review these documents carefully, as they describe your rights and restrictions with respect to this document. Code Components extracted from this document must include Simplified BSD License text as described in Section 4.e of the Trust Legal Provisions and are provided without warranty as described in the BSD License.</p><hr class="noprint"><h1 class="np" id="rfc.toc"><a href="#rfc.toc">Table of Contents</a></h1><ul class="toc"><li class="tocline0">1.???<a href="#rfc.section.1">Introduction</a><ul class="toc"><li class="tocline1">1.1???<a href="#rfc.section.1.1">Requirements Language</a></li></ul></li><li class="tocline0">2.???<a href="#rfc.section.2">URN Specification for "ogf" NID</a><ul class="toc"><li class="tocline1">2.1???<a href="#rfc.section.2.1">Namespace ID</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.2???<a href="#rfc.section.2.2">Registration Information</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.3???<a href="#rfc.section.2.3">Declared registrant of the namespace</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.4???<a href="#rfc.section.2.4">Declaration of syntactic structure</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.5???<a href="#rfc.section.2.5">Relevant ancillary documentation</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.6???<a href="#rfc.section.2.6">Identifier uniqueness considerations</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.7???<a href="#rfc.section.2.7">Identifier persistence considerations</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.8???<a href="#rfc.section.2.8">Process of identifier assignment</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.9???<a href="#rfc.section.2.9">Process of identifier resolution</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.10???<a href="#rfc.section.2.10">Rules for Lexical Equivalence</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.11???<a href="#rfc.section.2.11">Conformance with URN Syntax</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.12???<a href="#rfc.section.2.12">Validation mechanism</a></li><li class="tocline1">2.13???<a href="#rfc.section.2.13">Scope</a></li></ul></li><li class="tocline0">3.???<a href="#rfc.section.3">Examples (Informative)</a></li><li class="tocline0">4.???<a href="#rfc.section.4">Namespace Considerations</a></li><li class="tocline0">5.???<a href="#rfc.section.5">Community Considerations</a></li><li class="tocline0">6.???<a href="#Security">Security Considerations</a></li><li class="tocline0">7.???<a href="#IANA">IANA Considerations</a></li><li class="tocline0">8.???<a href="#rfc.section.8">Acknowledgements</a></li><li class="tocline0">9.???<a href="#rfc.references">References</a><ul class="toc"><li class="tocline1">9.1???<a href="#rfc.references.1">Normative References</a></li><li class="tocline1">9.2???<a href="#rfc.references.2">Informative References</a></li></ul></li><li class="tocline0"><a href="#rfc.authors">Authors' Addresses</a></li></ul><h1 id="rfc.section.1" class="np"><a href="#rfc.section.1">1.</a>?Introduction</h1><p id="rfc.section.1.p.1">The Open Grid Forum (OGF) is a standardisation development organisation in the field of distributed computing. The OGF produces documents such as working drafts, specifications, and schemata. For more information, see <a href="http://www.ogf.org/">http://www.ogf.org/</a></p><p id="rfc.section.1.p.2">Working groups in the OGF community have expressed the need for global, distributed, persistent identifiers in working drafts and standards. Motivated by this need, the OGF would like to assign URNs to some resources in order to retain unique, permanent, location-independent names for them.</p><p id="rfc.section.1.p.3">This namespace specification is for a formal namespace.</p><h2 id="rfc.section.1.1"><a href="#rfc.section.1.1">1.1</a>?Requirements Language</h2><p id="rfc.section.1.1.p.1">The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in <a href="#RFC2119"><cite title="Key words for use in RFCs to Indicate Requirement Levels">[RFC2119]</cite></a>.</p><h1 id="rfc.section.2"><a href="#rfc.section.2">2.</a>?URN Specification for "ogf" NID</h1><h2 id="rfc.section.2.1"><a href="#rfc.section.2.1">2.1</a>?Namespace ID</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.1.p.1">"ogf" requested.</p><h2 id="rfc.section.2.2"><a href="#rfc.section.2.2">2.2</a>?Registration Information</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.2.p.1">Registration Version Number: 1<br> Registration Date: yyyy-mm-dd <span class="comment" id="RFC-Editor">[<a href="#RFC-Editor" class="smpl">RFC-Editor</a>: Please replace with the date of approval of this document for publication as an RFC]</span> </p><h2 id="rfc.section.2.3"><a href="#rfc.section.2.3">2.3</a>?Declared registrant of the namespace</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.3.p.1">Technical Director<br> Open Grid Forum<br> P.O. Box 2326<br> Joliet, Illinois 60434<br> USA<br> http://www.ogf.org/</p><p id="rfc.section.2.3.p.2">Current contact person: </p><dl class="empty"><dd>Joel Replogle<br> Email: replogle@ogf.org <span class="comment" id="Joel Replogle">[<a href="#Joel%20Replogle" class="smpl">Joel Replogle</a>: Check if a generic mail address exists]</span> </dd></dl><h2 id="rfc.section.2.4"><a href="#rfc.section.2.4">2.4</a>?Declaration of syntactic structure</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.4.p.1">The formal syntax definitions below are given in <a href="#RFC5234">ABNF</a> <cite title="Augmented BNF for Syntax Specifications: ABNF">[RFC5234]</cite>.</p><p id="rfc.section.2.4.p.2">The NSS in the urn:ogf names hierarchy begins with a topic identifier, followed by a delimiter and a topic-dependent string</p><div id="rfc.figure.u.1"></div><pre class="inline">


  		





  
  293
  
    
   OGF-URN  =  "urn:ogf:" TOPIC-ID ":" TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING</pre><p id="rfc.section.2.4.p.4">where TOPIC-ID is a unique topic identifier for the specification, and TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING is a unique identifier within the topic identifier scope.</p><p id="rfc.section.2.4.p.5">TOPIC-ID has the same syntax as a &lt;NID&gt; as defined in <a href="#RFC2141"><cite title="URN Syntax">[RFC2141]</cite></a>:</p><div id="rfc.figure.u.2"></div><pre class="inline">


  		





  
  294
  
    
   TOPIC-ID  =  ( ALPHA / DIGIT )  *31( ALPHA / DIGIT / "-" )</pre><p id="rfc.section.2.4.p.7">ALPHA and DIGIT are defined in <a href="http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5234#appendix-B">Appendix B</a> of <a href="#RFC5234"><cite title="Augmented BNF for Syntax Specifications: ABNF">[RFC5234]</cite></a>.</p><p id="rfc.section.2.4.p.8">The Technical Director at OGF (or it successor) assigns topic identifiers <a href="#URN-OGF"><cite title="URN:OGF Hierarchy Registry and Documentation">[URN-OGF]</cite></a>.</p><p id="rfc.section.2.4.p.9">The syntax of TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING is dependent on the TOPIC-ID, and SHOULD be defined by a <a href="#GFD-SERIES">Grid Forum Document</a> <cite title="OGF Document Series">[GFD-SERIES]</cite>. This document does not pose any additional restrictions to the TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING than the NSS syntax as defined by <a href="#RFC2141"><cite title="URN Syntax">[RFC2141]</cite></a> or its successor:</p><div id="rfc.figure.u.3"></div><pre class="inline">


  		





  
  295
  
    
   TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING  =  1*&lt;URN chars&gt;


  		





  
  296
  
    
</pre><p id="rfc.section.2.4.p.11">URN-char is defined in <a href="http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2141#section-2.2">Section 2.2</a> of <a href="#RFC2141"><cite title="URN Syntax">[RFC2141]</cite></a>.</p><h2 id="rfc.section.2.5"><a href="#rfc.section.2.5">2.5</a>?Relevant ancillary documentation</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.5.p.1">The Technical Director at OGF (or it successor) will keep a list of assigned topic identifiers and associated documentation at <a href="http://www.ogf.org/urn/">http://www.ogf.org/urn/</a>.</p><p id="rfc.section.2.5.p.2">This website also contains information on the procedures how to register an topic identifier.</p><h2 id="rfc.section.2.6"><a href="#rfc.section.2.6">2.6</a>?Identifier uniqueness considerations</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.6.p.1">Identifier uniqueness will be enforced by the Technical Director of the Open Grid Forum.</p><h2 id="rfc.section.2.7"><a href="#rfc.section.2.7">2.7</a>?Identifier persistence considerations</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.7.p.1">The Technical Director will only assign topic identifiers for persistent resources <a href="#URN-OGF"><cite title="URN:OGF Hierarchy Registry and Documentation">[URN-OGF]</cite></a>.</p><h2 id="rfc.section.2.8"><a href="#rfc.section.2.8">2.8</a>?Process of identifier assignment</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.8.p.1">Assignment of topic identifiers is limited to the OGF and those authorities that are specifically designated by the OGF Technical Director. OGF may assign portions of its namespace (specifically, those under designated topic identifiers) for assignment by third parties.</p><p id="rfc.section.2.8.p.2">The details of this process will be specified at the OGF website <a href="#URN-OGF"><cite title="URN:OGF Hierarchy Registry and Documentation">[URN-OGF]</cite></a>.</p><p id="rfc.section.2.8.p.3">The syntax and semantics of each TOPIC-ID SHOULD be defined by a <a href="#GFD-SERIES">Grid Forum Document</a> <cite title="OGF Document Series">[GFD-SERIES]</cite> before it is assigned.</p><h2 id="rfc.section.2.9"><a href="#rfc.section.2.9">2.9</a>?Process of identifier resolution</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.9.p.1">OGF will maintain an index of all topic identifiers on its Web site, <a href="http://www.ogf.org/urn/">http://www.ogf.org/urn/</a><span class="comment" id="Joel2">[<a href="#Joel2" class="smpl">Joel2</a>: URL must be created]</span></p><p id="rfc.section.2.9.p.2">Resolution mechanism of TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING within each TOPIC-ID SHOULD be defined before assignment of a topic identifier.</p><h2 id="rfc.section.2.10"><a href="#rfc.section.2.10">2.10</a>?Rules for Lexical Equivalence</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.10.p.1">The TOPIC-ID part of URNs in the OGF hierarchy is case insensitive. Thus, the TOPIC-ID MUST be case normalised before comparison.</p><p id="rfc.section.2.10.p.2">The rules for lexical equivalence of the TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING part of URNs in the OGF hierarchy is specific for each TOPIC-ID and MUST be defined when a TOPIC-ID is assigned by the OGF Technical Director. These definitions MUST included information about case sensitivity, and in case %-escaped octets, MUST define the exact normalisation to use (interpret as octet, UTF-8, type of Unicode normalisation factor, etc.)</p><h2 id="rfc.section.2.11"><a href="#rfc.section.2.11">2.11</a>?Conformance with URN Syntax</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.11.p.1">Implementors should be aware that a revision of RFC2141 is proposed, which may allow a different set of allowed characters (URN-char) in the NSS than the current URN chars (adding "&amp;" and/or "~", whilst removing the reserved characters "%", "/", "?" and "#"). The intention of this document is to only restrict the syntax of the TOPIC-ID, and have Grid Forum Documents specify the syntax of the TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING. If RFC 2141 is to be updated, this document may be revised as well.</p><p id="rfc.section.2.11.p.2">In other words, the current definition:</p><div id="rfc.figure.u.4"></div><pre class="inline">


  		





  
  297
  
    
   TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING  =  1*&lt;URN chars&gt;


  		





  
  298
  
    
</pre><p id="rfc.section.2.11.p.4">is likely to change in the future to:</p><div id="rfc.figure.u.5"></div><pre class="inline">


  		





  
  299
  
    
   TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING  =  1*&lt;URN-char&gt;


  		





  
  300
  
    
</pre><h2 id="rfc.section.2.12"><a href="#rfc.section.2.12">2.12</a>?Validation mechanism</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.12.p.1">The validation mechanism of URNs in the OGF hierarchy is specific for each TOPIC-ID and MUST be defined when a TOPIC-ID is assigned by the OGF Technical Director.</p><p id="rfc.section.2.12.p.2">URNs in the OGF hierarchy without an assigned TOPIC-ID are considered to be invalid.</p><h2 id="rfc.section.2.13"><a href="#rfc.section.2.13">2.13</a>?Scope</h2><p id="rfc.section.2.13.p.1">Global URNs, relevant for the distributed computing community in general, and the Open Grid Forum in particular.</p><h1 id="rfc.section.3"><a href="#rfc.section.3">3.</a>?Examples (Informative)</h1><p id="rfc.section.3.p.1">The following examples are not guaranteed to be real or even syntactically correct. They are listed for pedagogical reasons only.</p><ul><li>urn:ogf:gfd:136</li><li>urn:ogf:network:canarie.ca:kisti-uninett-glif-001</li></ul><h1 id="rfc.section.4"><a href="#rfc.section.4">4.</a>?Namespace Considerations</h1><p id="rfc.section.4.p.1">The Open Grid Forum (OGF) is a standardisation development organisation in the field of distributed computing.</p><p id="rfc.section.4.p.2">The use of the OGF hierarchy is expected to be broad, including but not limit to usage for: </p><ul><li>Grid Forum Documents</li><li>XML (Extensible Markup Language) Schemata</li><li>RDF (Resource Description Framework) Schemata</li></ul><p id="rfc.section.4.p.3">The Open Grid Forum is dedicated to openly publish all technical documentation related to URNs in the OGF hierarchy and make this documentation available to all interested parties.</p><h1 id="rfc.section.5"><a href="#rfc.section.5">5.</a>?Community Considerations</h1><p id="rfc.section.5.p.1">Members of the distributed computing community will benefit from persistent and globally unique identifiers for use in protocols developed by the Open Grid Forum.</p><p id="rfc.section.5.p.2">Practical use of the urn:ogf namespace has been detected, and a formal registration will allow the Open Grid Forum to regulate its usage and enforce technical review of current practices.</p><h1 id="rfc.section.6"><a href="#rfc.section.6">6.</a>?<a id="Security" href="#Security">Security Considerations</a></h1><p id="rfc.section.6.p.1">There are no additional security considerations other than those normally associated with the use and resolution of URNs in general.</p><p id="rfc.section.6.p.2">Implementors are recommended to check the OGF registry and documentation <a href="#URN-OGF"><cite title="URN:OGF Hierarchy Registry and Documentation">[URN-OGF]</cite></a> before assuming that a given identifier is valid or has a certain meaning.</p><h1 id="rfc.section.7"><a href="#rfc.section.7">7.</a>?<a id="IANA" href="#IANA">IANA Considerations</a></h1><p id="rfc.section.7.p.1">IANA is to kindly requested to register the "ogf" namespace identifier (NID) at the <a href="#URN-NAMESPACES">URN Namespaces registry</a> <cite title="Official IANA Registry of URN Namespaces">[URN-NAMESPACES]</cite> and refer to this document and/or the website <a href="http://www.ogf.org/urn/">http://www.ogf.org/urn/</a>.</p><h1 id="rfc.section.8"><a href="#rfc.section.8">8.</a>?Acknowledgements</h1><p id="rfc.section.8.p.1">The authors like to thank Joel Replogle for helping set up the urn:ogf registry. The template and useful examples from <a href="#RFC3406"><cite title="Uniform Resource Names (URN) Namespace Definition Mechanisms">[RFC3406]</cite></a> formed the basis of this document.</p><h1 id="rfc.references"><a id="rfc.section.9" href="#rfc.section.9">9.</a> References</h1><h2 id="rfc.references.1"><a href="#rfc.section.9.1" id="rfc.section.9.1">9.1</a> Normative References</h2><table>        <tr><td class="reference"><b id="RFC2119">[RFC2119]</b></td><td class="top"><a href="mailto:sob@harvard.edu" title="Harvard University">Bradner, S.</a>, &#8220;<a href="http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2119">Key words for use in RFCs to Indicate Requirement Levels</a>&#8221;, BCP?14, RFC?2119, March?1997.</td></tr><tr><td class="reference"><b id="RFC2141">[RFC2141]</b></td><td class="top"><a href="mailto:jayhawk@ds.internic.net" title="AT&amp;T">Moats, R.</a>, &#8220;<a href="http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2141">URN Syntax</a>&#8221;, RFC?2141, May?1997.</td></tr><tr><td class="reference"><b id="RFC5234">[RFC5234]</b></td><td class="top">Crocker, D. and P. Overell, &#8220;<a href="http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5234">Augmented BNF for Syntax Specifications: ABNF</a>&#8221;, STD?68, RFC?5234, January?2008.</td></tr></table><h2 id="rfc.references.2"><a href="#rfc.section.9.2" id="rfc.section.9.2">9.2</a> Informative References</h2><table>        <tr><td class="reference"><b id="GFD-SERIES">[GFD-SERIES]</b></td><td class="top">Open Grid Forum, &#8220;<a href="http://www.ogf.org/gf/docs/">OGF Document Series</a>&#8221;, &lt;<a href="http://www.ogf.org/gf/docs/">http://www.ogf.org/gf/docs/</a>&gt;.</td></tr><tr><td class="reference"><b id="RFC3406">[RFC3406]</b></td><td class="top">Daigle, L., van Gulik, D., Iannella, R., and P. Faltstrom, &#8220;<a href="http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3406">Uniform Resource Names (URN) Namespace Definition Mechanisms</a>&#8221;, BCP?66, RFC?3406, October?2002.</td></tr><tr><td class="reference"><b id="URN-NAMESPACES">[URN-NAMESPACES]</b></td><td class="top">IANA, &#8220;<a href="http://www.iana.org/assignments/urn-namespaces/">Official IANA Registry of URN Namespaces</a>&#8221;, &lt;<a href="http://www.iana.org/assignments/urn-namespaces/">http://www.iana.org/assignments/urn-namespaces/</a>&gt;.</td></tr><tr><td class="reference"><b id="URN-OGF">[URN-OGF]</b></td><td class="top">Open Grid Forum, &#8220;<a href="http://www.ogf.org/urn/">URN:OGF Hierarchy Registry and Documentation</a>&#8221;, &lt;<a href="http://www.ogf.org/urn/">http://www.ogf.org/urn/</a>&gt;.</td></tr></table><div class="avoidbreak"><h1 id="rfc.authors"><a href="#rfc.authors">Authors' Addresses</a></h1><address class="vcard"><span class="vcardline"><span class="fn">Freek Dijkstra</span><span class="n hidden"><span class="family-name">Dijkstra</span><span class="given-name">Freek</span></span></span><span       b/draft-urn-ogf.txt
    
  






  1
  
  
    
INFORMATIONAL


  		





  2
  
  
    

  		





  3
  
  
    
Network Working Group                                        F. Dijkstra


  		





  4
  
  
    
Request for Comments: xxxx                                          SARA


  		





  5
  
  
    
Category: Informational                                  R. Hughes-Jones


  		





  6
  
  
    
                                                                   DANTE


  		





  7
  
  
    
                                                            October 2009


  		





  8
  
  
    

  		





  9
  
  
    

  		





  10
  
  
    
                   A URN Namespace for OGF Documents


  		





  11
  
  
    

  		





  12
  
  
    
Status of this Memo


  		





  13
  
  
    

  		





  14
  
  
    
   This memo provides information for the Internet community.  It does


  		





  15
  
  
    
   not specify an Internet standard of any kind.  Distribution of this


  		





  16
  
  
    
   memo is unlimited.


  		





  17
  
  
    

  		





  18
  
  
    
Copyright Notice


  		





  19
  
  
    

  		





  20
  
  
    
   Copyright (C) The Internet Society (2009).  All Rights Reserved.


  		





  21
  
  
    

  		





  22
  
  
    
Abstract


  		





  23
  
  
    

  		





  24
  
  
    
   This document describes a URN (Uniform Resource Name) namespace that


  		





  25
  
  
    
   is engineered by the Open Grid Forum (OGF) for naming persistent resources


  		





  26
  
  
    
   published by OGF (such as OGF Standards, XML (Extensible Markup


  		





  27
  
  
    
   Language) Document Type Definitions, XML Schemas, Namespaces,


  		





  28
  
  
    
   Stylesheets, and other documents).


  		





  29
  
  
    

  		





  30
  
  
    
1. Introduction


  		





  31
  
  
    

  		





  32
  
  
    
   The Open Grid Forum (OGF) produces many kinds of documents: specifications,


  		





  33
  
  
    
   working drafts, technical resolutions, schemas, stylesheets, etc.


  		





  34
  
  
    

  		





  35
  
  
    
   The OGF wishes to provide global, distributed, persistent, location-


  		





  36
  
  
    
   independent names for these resources.


  		





  37
  
  
    

  		





  38
  
  
    
   The Extensible Markup Language (XML) requires that all resources


  		





  39
  
  
    
   provide a system identifier, which must be a URI, in addition to an


  		





  40
  
  
    
   optional public identifier (which provides an alternate mechanism for


  		





  41
  
  
    
   constructing identifiers) and many evolving specifications require


  		





  42
  
  
    
   authors to identify documents by URI alone (XML Namespaces, XML


  		





  43
  
  
    
   Schema, XSLT, etc.).


  		





  44
  
  
    

  		





  45
  
  
    
   Motivated by these observations, OGF would like to assign URNs to


  		





  46
  
  
    
   some resources in order to retain unique, permanent location-


  		





  47
  
  
    
   independent names for them.


  		





  48
  
  
    

  		





  49
  
  
    
   This namespace specification is for a formal namespace.


  		





  50
  
  
    

  		





  51
  
  
    
2. Specification Template


  		





  52
  
  
    

  		





  53
  
  
    
   Namespace ID:


  		





  54
  
  
    

  		





  55
  
  
    
      "ogf" requested.


  		





  56
  
  
    

  		





  57
  
  
    
   Registration Information:


  		





  58
  
  
    

  		





  59
  
  
    
      Registration Version Number: ***


  		





  60
  
  
    
      Registration Date: yyyy-mm-dd  ***


  		





  61
  
  
    

  		





  62
  
  
    
   Declared registrant of the namespace:


  		





  63
  
  
    

  		





  64
  
  
    
      Technical Director


  		





  65
  
  
    
      OGF - Open Grid Forum


  		





  66
  
  
    
      Open Grid Forum


  		





  67
  
  
    
      P.O. Box 2326


  		





  68
  
  
    
      Joliet, Illinois 60434


  		





  69
  
  
    
      USA


  		





  70
  
  
    
      Email: replogle@ogf.org  ***


  		





  71
  
  
    

  		





  72
  
  
    
   Declaration of syntactic structure:


  		





  73
  
  
    

  		





  74
  
  
    
      The NSS in the urn:ogf names hierarchy begins with a topic


  		





  75
  
  
    
      identifier.


  		





  76
  
  
    
      


  		





  77
  
  
    
      Specifications


  		





  78
  
  
    

  		





  79
  
  
    
         The


  		





  80
  
  
    
         general structure of the URN is a hierarchy which has


  		





  81
  
  
    
         the form:


  		





  82
  
  
    

  		





  83
  
  
    
            <OGF URN>  ::=  "urn:ogf:" <topic-id> ":" <topic-dependent-id>


  		





  84
  
  
    

  		





  85
  
  
    
         where "topic-id" is a unique topic identifier for the


  		





  86
  
  
    
         specification, and "topic-dependent-id" is a unique identifier within the "topic-id" scope.


  		





  87
  
  
    
         


  		





  88
  
  
    
         topic-id follows the syntax of a <NID> as defined in RFC 2141 [1]:


  		





  89
  
  
    
         


  		





  90
  
  
    
           <topic-id>    ::= <NID>


  		





  91
  
  
    
           


  		





  92
  
  
    
         where:


  		





  93
  
  
    
         


  		





  94
  
  
    
           <NID>         ::= <let-num> [ 1,31<let-num-hyp> ]


  		





  95
  
  
    
           <let-num-hyp> ::= <upper> | <lower> | <number> | "-"


  		





  96
  
  
    
           <let-num>     ::= <upper> | <lower> | <number>


  		





  97
  
  
    
           <upper>       ::= "A" | "B" | "C" | "D" | "E" | "F" | "G" | "H" |


  		





  98
  
  
    
                             "I" | "J" | "K" | "L" | "M" | "N" | "O" | "P" |


  		





  99
  
  
    
                             "Q" | "R" | "S" | "T" | "U" | "V" | "W" | "X" |


  		





  100
  
  
    
                             "Y" | "Z"


  		





  101
  
  
    
           <lower>       ::= "a" | "b" | "c" | "d" | "e" | "f" | "g" | "h" |


  		





  102
  
  
    
                             "i" | "j" | "k" | "l" | "m" | "n" | "o" | "p" |


  		





  103
  
  
    
                             "q" | "r" | "s" | "t" | "u" | "v" | "w" | "x" |


  		





  104
  
  
    
                             "y" | "z"


  		





  105
  
  
    
           <number>      ::= "0" | "1" | "2" | "3" | "4" | "5" | "6" | "7" |


  		





  106
  
  
    
                             "8" | "9"


  		





  107
  
  
    
         


  		





  108
  
  
    
         The syntax of topic-dependent-id is dependent on the topic-id, and should be defined by a OGF Standard. The general syntax for topic-dependent-id follows the syntax of a <NSS> as defined in RFC 2141 [1]:


  		





  109
  
  
    
         


  		





  110
  
  
    
           <topic-dependent-id> ::= <NSS>


  		





  111
  
  
    
           


  		





  112
  
  
    
         where:


  		





  113
  
  
    
         


  		





  114
  
  
    
           <NSS>         ::= 1*<URN chars>


  		





  115
  
  
    
           <URN chars>   ::= <trans> | "%" <hex> <hex>


  		





  116
  
  
    
           <trans>       ::= <upper> | <lower> | <number> | <other> | <reserved>


  		





  117
  
  
    
           <hex>         ::= <number> | "A" | "B" | "C" | "D" | "E" | "F" |


  		





  118
  
  
    
                             "a" | "b" | "c" | "d" | "e" | "f"


  		





  119
  
  
    
           <other>       ::= "(" | ")" | "+" | "," | "-" | "." |


  		





  120
  
  
    
                             ":" | "=" | "@" | ";" | "$" |


  		





  121
  
  
    
                             "_" | "!" | "*" | "'"


  		





  122
  
  
    
      


  		





  123
  
  
    
      Procedure for registering topic identifiers


  		





  124
  
  
    
      


  		





  125
  
  
    
         The Technical Director at OGF (or it successor) assigns topic identifiers.


  		





  126
  
  
    
         


  		





  127
  
  
    
         ****


  		





  128
  
  
    

  		





  129
  
  
    
   Relevant ancillary documentation:


  		





  130
  
  
    

  		





  131
  
  
    
      None *** (sure, what procedures do we already have?)


  		





  132
  
  
    

  		





  133
  
  
    
   Identifier uniqueness considerations:


  		





  134
  
  
    

  		





  135
  
  
    
      Identifier uniqueness will be enforced by the Director of


  		





  136
  
  
    
      Technical Operations who assigns unique identifiers to all


  		





  137
  
  
    
      documents identified by URN.


  		





  138
  
  
    

  		





  139
  
  
    
   Identifier persistence considerations:


  		





  140
  
  
    

  		





  141
  
  
    
      OGF (or its successor) is committed to maintaining the accessibility and


  		





  142
  
  
    
      persistence of all OGF URNs. This responsibility may be


  		





  143
  
  
    
      delegated to subordinate naming authorities.


  		





  144
  
  
    

  		





  145
  
  
    
   Process of identifier assignment:


  		





  146
  
  
    

  		





  147
  
  
    
      Assignment of topic identifiers is limited to the OGF and those authorities that are


  		





  148
  
  
    
      specifically designated by the OGF Technical Director. OGF may assign portions


  		





  149
  
  
    
      of its namespace (specifically, those under designated topic identifiers)


  		





  150
  
  
    
      for assignment by third parties.


  		





  151
  
  
    

  		





  152
  
  
    
   Process of identifier resolution:


  		





  153
  
  
    

  		





  154
  
  
    
         OGF will maintain an index of all topic identifiers


  		





  155
  
  
    
         on its Web site,


  		





  156
  
  
    
         http://www.ogf.org/***.


  		





  157
  
  
    

  		





  158
  
  
    
   Rules for Lexical Equivalence:


  		





  159
  
  
    

  		





  160
  
  
    
      URNs are lexically equivalent if they are lexically identical.


  		





  161
  
  
    
      


  		





  162
  
  
    
      *** need reference to "lexically identical" RFC 2141, RFC 3406?


  		





  163
  
  
    
      *** Normalization form before lexical comparison? (case, Unicode NFC, International domain names,....)


  		





  164
  
  
    

  		





  165
  
  
    
   Conformance with URN Syntax:


  		





  166
  
  
    

  		





  167
  
  
    
      No special considerations.


  		





  168
  
  
    

  		





  169
  
  
    
   Validation mechanism:


  		





  170
  
  
    

  		





  171
  
  
    
        The validation mechanism of URNs in the OGF hierarchy is specific for each topic-id and MUST be defined when a topic-id is assigned by the OGF Technical Director.


  		





  172
  
  
    
        


  		





  173
  
  
    
        The OGF website http://www.ogf.org/*** will refer to the document describing the validation mechanism for each topic-id.


  		





  174
  
  
    

  		





  175
  
  
    
        URNs in the OGF hierarchy without an assigned topic-id are considered to be invalid.


  		





  176
  
  
    

  		





  177
  
  
    
   Scope:


  		





  178
  
  
    

  		





  179
  
  
    
      Global, OGF related URNs.


  		





  180
  
  
    

  		





  181
  
  
    
3. Examples


  		





  182
  
  
    

  		





  183
  
  
    
   The following examples are not guaranteed to be real.  They are


  		





  184
  
  
    
   listed for pedagogical reasons only. These three URNs represent three different resources.


  		





  185
  
  
    

  		





  186
  
  
    
      urn:ogf:network:example.org:42


  		





  187
  
  
    
      urn:ogf:network:example.net:opaque


  		





  188
  
  
    
      urn:ogf:wg:cheeseshop


  		





  189
  
  
    

  		





  190
  
  
    
4. Security Considerations


  		





  191
  
  
    

  		





  192
  
  
    
   There are no additional security considerations other than those


  		





  193
  
  
    
   normally associated with the use and resolution of URNs in general.


  		





  194
  
  
    

  		





  195
  
  
    
References


  		





  196
  
  
    

  		





  197
  
  
    
   [1] Moats, R., "URN Syntax", RFC 2141, May 1997.


  		





  198
  
  
    

  		





  199

Network Working Group                                        F. Dijkstra


  		





  
  5
  
    
Internet-Draft                                                      SARA


  		





  
  6
  
    
Intended status: Informational                           R. Hughes-Jones


  		





  
  7
  
    
Expires: May 12, 2011                                              DANTE


  		





  
  8
  
    
                                                        November 8, 2010


  		





  
  9
  
    

  		





  
  10
  
    

  		





  
  11
  
    
             A URN Namespace for the Open Grid Forum (OGF)


  		





  
  12
  
    
                         draft-dijkstra-urn-ogf


  		





  
  13
  
    

  		





  
  14
  
    
Abstract


  		





  
  15
  
    

  		





  
  16
  
    
   This document describes a URN (Uniform Resource Name) namespace that


  		





  
  17
  
    
   is engineered by the Open Grid Forum (OGF) for naming persistent


  		





  
  18
  
    
   resources.


  		





  
  19
  
    

  		





  
  20
  
    
Status of this Memo


  		





  
  21
  
    

  		





  
  22
  
    
   This Internet-Draft is submitted in full conformance with the


  		





  
  23
  
    
   provisions of BCP 78 and BCP 79.


  		





  
  24
  
    

  		





  
  25
  
    
   Internet-Drafts are working documents of the Internet Engineering


  		





  
  26
  
    
   Task Force (IETF).  Note that other groups may also distribute


  		





  
  27
  
    
   working documents as Internet-Drafts.  The list of current Internet-


  		





  
  28
  
    
   Drafts is at http://datatracker.ietf.org/drafts/current/.


  		





  
  29
  
    

  		





  
  30
  
    
   Internet-Drafts are draft documents valid for a maximum of six months


  		





  
  31
  
    
   and may be updated, replaced, or obsoleted by other documents at any


  		





  
  32
  
    
   time.  It is inappropriate to use Internet-Drafts as reference


  		





  
  33
  
    
   material or to cite them other than as "work in progress."


  		





  
  34
  
    

  		





  
  35
  
    
   This Internet-Draft will expire on May 12, 2011.


  		





  
  36
  
    

  		





  
  37

  38
  
    

  		





  
  39
  
    
   Copyright (c) 2010 IETF Trust and the persons identified as the


  		





  
  40
  
    
   document authors.  All rights reserved.


  		





  
  41
  
    

  		





  
  42
  
    
   This document is subject to BCP 78 and the IETF Trust's Legal


  		





  
  43
  
    
   Provisions Relating to IETF Documents


  		





  
  44
  
    
   (http://trustee.ietf.org/license-info) in effect on the date of


  		





  
  45
  
    
   publication of this document.  Please review these documents


  		





  
  46
  
    
   carefully, as they describe your rights and restrictions with respect


  		





  
  47
  
    
   to this document.


  		





  
  48
  
    

  		





  
  49
  
    

  		





  
  50
  
    

  		





  
  51
  
    

  		





  
  52
  
    

  		





  
  53
  
    

  		





  
  54
  
    

  		





  
  55
  
    
Dijkstra & Hughes-Jones   Expires May 12, 2011                  [Page 1]


  		





  
  56
  
    



  		





  
  57
  
    
Internet-Draft          URN Namespace for the OGF          November 2010


  		





  
  58
  
    

  		





  
  59
  
    

  		





  
  60

  64
  
    
   2.  URN Specification for "ogf" NID . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 3


  		





  
  65

  66
  
    
     2.2.  Registration Information  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 3


  		





  
  67
  
    
     2.3.  Declared registrant of the namespace  . . . . . . . . . . . 3

  69

  70

  71
  
    
     2.7.  Identifier persistence considerations . . . . . . . . . . . 5


  		





  
  72

  73

  74

  75
  
    
     2.11. Conformance with URN Syntax . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 5


  		





  
  76
  
    
     2.12. Validation mechanism  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 6


  		





  
  77
  
    
     2.13. Scope . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 6


  		





  
  78
  
    
   3.  Examples (Informative)  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 6


  		





  
  79
  
    
   4.  Namespace Considerations  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 6


  		





  
  80
  
    
   5.  Community Considerations  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 7


  		





  
  81
  
    
   6.  Security Considerations . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 7


  		





  
  82
  
    
   7.  IANA Considerations . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 7


  		





  
  83
  
    
   8.  Acknowledgements  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 7


  		





  
  84
  
    
   9.  References  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 7


  		





  
  85
  
    
     9.1.  Normative References  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 7


  		





  
  86
  
    
     9.2.  Informative References  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 8


  		





  
  87
  
    
   Authors' Addresses  . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 8


  		





  
  88
  
    

  		





  
  89
  
    

  		





  
  90
  
    

  		





  
  91
  
    

  		





  
  92
  
    

  		





  
  93
  
    

  		





  
  94
  
    

  		





  
  95
  
    

  		





  
  96
  
    

  		





  
  97
  
    

  		





  
  98
  
    

  		





  
  99
  
    

  		





  
  100
  
    

  		





  
  101
  
    

  		





  
  102
  
    

  		





  
  103
  
    

  		





  
  104
  
    

  		





  
  105
  
    

  		





  
  106
  
    

  		





  
  107
  
    

  		





  
  108
  
    

  		





  
  109
  
    

  		





  
  110
  
    

  		





  
  111
  
    
Dijkstra & Hughes-Jones   Expires May 12, 2011                  [Page 2]


  		





  
  112
  
    



  		





  
  113
  
    
Internet-Draft          URN Namespace for the OGF          November 2010


  		





  
  114
  
    

  		





  
  115
  
    

  		





  
  116
  
    
1.  Introduction


  		





  
  117
  
    

  		





  
  118
  
    
   The Open Grid Forum (OGF) is a standardisation development


  		





  
  119
  
    
   organisation in the field of distributed computing.  The OGF produces


  		





  
  120
  
    
   documents such as working drafts, specifications, and schemata.  For


  		





  
  121
  
    
   more information, see http://www.ogf.org/


  		





  
  122
  
    

  		





  
  123
  
    
   Working groups in the OGF community have expressed the need for


  		





  
  124
  
    
   global, distributed, persistent identifiers in working drafts and


  		





  
  125
  
    
   standards.  Motivated by this need, the OGF would like to assign URNs


  		





  
  126
  
    
   to some resources in order to retain unique, permanent, location-


  		





  
  127
  
    
   independent names for them.


  		





  
  128
  
    

  		





  
  129
  
    
   This namespace specification is for a formal namespace.


  		





  
  130
  
    

  		





  
  131
  
    
1.1.  Requirements Language


  		





  
  132
  
    

  		





  
  133
  
    
   The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT",


  		





  
  134
  
    
   "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this


  		





  
  135
  
    
   document are to be interpreted as described in [RFC2119].


  		





  
  136
  
    

  		





  
  137
  
    

  		





  
  138
  
    
2.  URN Specification for "ogf" NID


  		





  
  139
  
    

  		





  
  140
  
    
2.1.  Namespace ID


  		





  
  141
  
    

  		





  
  142
  
    
   "ogf" requested.


  		





  
  143
  
    

  		





  
  144
  
    
2.2.  Registration Information


  		





  
  145
  
    

  		





  
  146
  
    
   Registration Version Number: 1


  		





  
  147
  
    
   Registration Date: yyyy-mm-dd [[RFC-Editor: Please replace with the


  		





  
  148
  
    
   date of approval of this document for publication as an RFC]]


  		





  
  149
  
    

  		





  
  150
  
    
2.3.  Declared registrant of the namespace


  		





  
  151
  
    

  		





  
  152
  
    
   Technical Director


  		





  
  153
  
    
   Open Grid Forum


  		





  
  154
  
    
   P.O. Box 2326


  		





  
  155
  
    
   Joliet, Illinois 60434


  		





  
  156
  
    
   USA


  		





  
  157
  
    
   http://www.ogf.org/


  		





  
  158
  
    

  		





  
  159
  
    
   Current contact person:


  		





  
  160
  
    

  		





  
  161
  
    
      Joel Replogle


  		





  
  162
  
    
      Email: replogle@ogf.org [[Joel Replogle: Check if a generic mail


  		





  
  163
  
    
      address exists]]


  		





  
  164
  
    

  		





  
  165
  
    

  		





  
  166
  
    

  		





  
  167
  
    
Dijkstra & Hughes-Jones   Expires May 12, 2011                  [Page 3]


  		





  
  168
  
    



  		





  
  169
  
    
Internet-Draft          URN Namespace for the OGF          November 2010


  		





  
  170
  
    

  		





  
  171
  
    

  		





  
  172
  
    
2.4.  Declaration of syntactic structure


  		





  
  173
  
    

  		





  
  174
  
    
   The formal syntax definitions below are given in ABNF [RFC5234].


  		





  
  175
  
    

  		





  
  176
  
    
   The NSS in the urn:ogf names hierarchy begins with a topic


  		





  
  177
  
    
   identifier, followed by a delimiter and a topic-dependent string


  		





  
  178
  
    

  		





  
  179
  
    
      OGF-URN  =  "urn:ogf:" TOPIC-ID ":" TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING


  		





  
  180
  
    

  		





  
  181
  
    
   where TOPIC-ID is a unique topic identifier for the specification,


  		





  
  182
  
    
   and TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING is a unique identifier within the topic


  		





  
  183
  
    
   identifier scope.


  		





  
  184
  
    

  		





  
  185
  
    
   TOPIC-ID has the same syntax as a <NID> as defined in [RFC2141]:


  		





  
  186
  
    

  		





  
  187
  
    
      TOPIC-ID  =  ( ALPHA / DIGIT )  *31( ALPHA / DIGIT / "-" )


  		





  
  188
  
    

  		





  
  189
  
    
   ALPHA and DIGIT are defined in Appendix B of [RFC5234].


  		





  
  190
  
    

  		





  
  191
  
    
   The Technical Director at OGF (or it successor) assigns topic


  		





  
  192
  
    
   identifiers [URN-OGF].


  		





  
  193
  
    

  		





  
  194
  
    
   The syntax of TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING is dependent on the TOPIC-ID, and


  		





  
  195
  
    
   SHOULD be defined by a Grid Forum Document [GFD-SERIES].  This


  		





  
  196
  
    
   document does not pose any additional restrictions to the TOPIC-


  		





  
  197
  
    
   SPECIFIC-STRING than the NSS syntax as defined by [RFC2141] or its


  		





  
  198
  
    
   successor:


  		





  
  199
  
    

  		





  
  200
  
    
      TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING  =  1*<URN chars>


  		





  
  201
  
    

  		





  
  202
  
    
   URN-char is defined in Section 2.2 of [RFC2141].


  		





  
  203
  
    

  		





  
  204
  
    
2.5.  Relevant ancillary documentation


  		





  
  205
  
    

  		





  
  206
  
    
   The Technical Director at OGF (or it successor) will keep a list of


  		





  
  207
  
    
   assigned topic identifiers and associated documentation at


  		





  
  208
  
    
   http://www.ogf.org/urn/.


  		





  
  209
  
    

  		





  
  210
  
    
   This website also contains information on the procedures how to


  		





  
  211
  
    
   register an topic identifier.


  		





  
  212
  
    

  		





  
  213
  
    
2.6.  Identifier uniqueness considerations


  		





  
  214
  
    

  		





  
  215
  
    
   Identifier uniqueness will be enforced by the Technical Director of


  		





  
  216
  
    
   the Open Grid Forum.


  		





  
  217
  
    

  		





  
  218
  
    

  		





  
  219
  
    

  		





  
  220
  
    

  		





  
  221
  
    

  		





  
  222
  
    

  		





  
  223
  
    
Dijkstra & Hughes-Jones   Expires May 12, 2011                  [Page 4]


  		





  
  224
  
    



  		





  
  225
  
    
Internet-Draft          URN Namespace for the OGF          November 2010


  		





  
  226
  
    

  		





  
  227
  
    

  		





  
  228
  
    
2.7.  Identifier persistence considerations


  		





  
  229
  
    

  		





  
  230
  
    
   The Technical Director will only assign topic identifiers for


  		





  
  231
  
    
   persistent resources [URN-OGF].


  		





  
  232
  
    

  		





  
  233
  
    
2.8.  Process of identifier assignment


  		





  
  234
  
    

  		





  
  235
  
    
   Assignment of topic identifiers is limited to the OGF and those


  		





  
  236
  
    
   authorities that are specifically designated by the OGF Technical


  		





  
  237
  
    
   Director.  OGF may assign portions of its namespace (specifically,


  		





  
  238
  
    
   those under designated topic identifiers) for assignment by third


  		





  
  239
  
    
   parties.


  		





  
  240
  
    

  		





  
  241
  
    
   The details of this process will be specified at the OGF website


  		





  
  242
  
    
   [URN-OGF].


  		





  
  243
  
    

  		





  
  244
  
    
   The syntax and semantics of each TOPIC-ID SHOULD be defined by a Grid


  		





  
  245
  
    
   Forum Document [GFD-SERIES] before it is assigned.


  		





  
  246
  
    

  		





  
  247
  
    
2.9.  Process of identifier resolution


  		





  
  248
  
    

  		





  
  249
  
    
   OGF will maintain an index of all topic identifiers on its Web site,


  		





  
  250
  
    
   http://www.ogf.org/urn/[[Joel2: URL must be created]]


  		





  
  251
  
    

  		





  
  252
  
    
   Resolution mechanism of TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING within each TOPIC-ID


  		





  
  253
  
    
   SHOULD be defined before assignment of a topic identifier.


  		





  
  254
  
    

  		





  
  255
  
    
2.10.  Rules for Lexical Equivalence


  		





  
  256
  
    

  		





  
  257
  
    
   The TOPIC-ID part of URNs in the OGF hierarchy is case insensitive.


  		





  
  258
  
    
   Thus, the TOPIC-ID MUST be case normalised before comparison.


  		





  
  259
  
    

  		





  
  260
  
    
   The rules for lexical equivalence of the TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING part


  		





  
  261
  
    
   of URNs in the OGF hierarchy is specific for each TOPIC-ID and MUST


  		





  
  262
  
    
   be defined when a TOPIC-ID is assigned by the OGF Technical Director.


  		





  
  263
  
    
   These definitions MUST included information about case sensitivity,


  		





  
  264
  
    
   and in case %-escaped octets, MUST define the exact normalisation to


  		





  
  265
  
    
   use (interpret as octet, UTF-8, type of Unicode normalisation factor,


  		





  
  266
  
    
   etc.)


  		





  
  267
  
    

  		





  
  268
  
    
2.11.  Conformance with URN Syntax


  		





  
  269
  
    

  		





  
  270
  
    
   Implementors should be aware that a revision of RFC2141 is proposed,


  		





  
  271
  
    
   which may allow a different set of allowed characters (URN-char) in


  		





  
  272
  
    
   the NSS than the current URN chars (adding "&" and/or "~", whilst


  		





  
  273
  
    
   removing the reserved characters "%", "/", "?" and "#").  The


  		





  
  274
  
    
   intention of this document is to only restrict the syntax of the


  		





  
  275
  
    
   TOPIC-ID, and have Grid Forum Documents specify the syntax of the


  		





  
  276
  
    

  		





  
  277
  
    

  		





  
  278
  
    

  		





  
  279
  
    
Dijkstra & Hughes-Jones   Expires May 12, 2011                  [Page 5]


  		





  
  280
  
    



  		





  
  281
  
    
Internet-Draft          URN Namespace for the OGF          November 2010


  		





  
  282
  
    

  		





  
  283
  
    

  		





  
  284
  
    
   TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING.  If RFC 2141 is to be updated, this document


  		





  
  285
  
    
   may be revised as well.


  		





  
  286
  
    

  		





  
  287
  
    
   In other words, the current definition:


  		





  
  288
  
    

  		





  
  289
  
    
      TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING  =  1*<URN chars>


  		





  
  290
  
    

  		





  
  291
  
    
   is likely to change in the future to:


  		





  
  292
  
    

  		





  
  293
  
    
      TOPIC-SPECIFIC-STRING  =  1*<URN-char>


  		





  
  294
  
    

  		





  
  295
  
    
2.12.  Validation mechanism


  		





  
  296
  
    

  		





  
  297
  
    
   The validation mechanism of URNs in the OGF hierarchy is specific for


  		





  
  298
  
    
   each TOPIC-ID and MUST be defined when a TOPIC-ID is assigned by the


  		





  
  299
  
    
   OGF Technical Director.


  		





  
  300
  
    

  		





  
  301
  
    
   URNs in the OGF hierarchy without an assigned TOPIC-ID are considered


  		





  
  302
  
    
   to be invalid.


  		





  
  303
  
    

  		





  
  304
  
    
2.13.  Scope


  		





  
  305
  
    

  		





  
  306
  
    
   Global URNs, relevant for the distributed computing community in


  		





  
  307
  
    
   general, and the Open Grid Forum in particular.


  		





  
  308
  
    

  		





  
  309
  
    

  		





  
  310
  
    
3.  Examples (Informative)


  		





  
  311
  
    

  		





  
  312
  
    
   The following examples are not guaranteed to be real or even


  		





  
  313
  
    
   syntactically correct.  They are listed for pedagogical reasons only.


  		





  
  314
  
    

  		





  
  315
  
    
   o  urn:ogf:gfd:136


  		





  
  316
  
    

  		





  
  317
  
    
   o  urn:ogf:network:canarie.ca:kisti-uninett-glif-001


  		





  
  318
  
    

  		





  
  319
  
    

  		





  
  320
  
    
4.  Namespace Considerations


  		





  
  321
  
    

  		





  
  322
  
    
   The Open Grid Forum (OGF) is a standardisation development


  		





  
  323
  
    
   organisation in the field of distributed computing.


  		





  
  324
  
    

  		





  
  325
  
    
   The use of the OGF hierarchy is expected to be broad, including but


  		





  
  326
  
    
   not limit to usage for:


  		





  
  327
  
    

  		





  
  328
  
    
   o  Grid Forum Documents


  		





  
  329
  
    

  		





  
  330
  
    
   o  XML (Extensible Markup Language) Schemata


  		





  
  331
  
    

  		





  
  332
  
    

  		





  
  333
  
    

  		





  
  334
  
    

  		





  
  335
  
    
Dijkstra & Hughes-Jones   Expires May 12, 2011                  [Page 6]


  		





  
  336
  
    



  		





  
  337
  
    
Internet-Draft          URN Namespace for the OGF          November 2010


  		





  
  338
  
    

  		





  
  339
  
    

  		





  
  340
  
    
   o  RDF (Resource Description Framework) Schemata


  		





  
  341
  
    

  		





  
  342
  
    
   The Open Grid Forum is dedicated to openly publish all technical


  		





  
  343
  
    
   documentation related to URNs in the OGF hierarchy and make this


  		





  
  344
  
    
   documentation available to all interested parties.


  		





  
  345
  
    

  		





  
  346
  
    

  		





  
  347
  
    
5.  Community Considerations


  		





  
  348
  
    

  		





  
  349
  
    
   Members of the distributed computing community will benefit from


  		





  
  350
  
    
   persistent and globally unique identifiers for use in protocols


  		





  
  351
  
    
   developed by the Open Grid Forum.


  		





  
  352
  
    

  		





  
  353
  
    
   Practical use of the urn:ogf namespace has been detected, and a


  		





  
  354
  
    
   formal registration will allow the Open Grid Forum to regulate its


  		





  
  355
  
    
   usage and enforce technical review of current practices.


  		





  
  356
  
    

  		





  
  357
  
    

  		





  
  358
  
    
6.  Security Considerations


  		





  
  359
  
    

  		





  
  360
  
    
   There are no additional security considerations other than those


  		





  
  361
  
    
   normally associated with the use and resolution of URNs in general.


  		





  
  362
  
    

  		





  
  363
  
    
   Implementors are recommended to check the OGF registry and


  		





  
  364
  
    
   documentation [URN-OGF] before assuming that a given identifier is


  		





  
  365
  
    
   valid or has a certain meaning.


  		





  
  366
  
    

  		





  
  367
  
    

  		





  
  368
  
    
7.  IANA Considerations


  		





  
  369
  
    

  		





  
  370
  
    
   IANA is to kindly requested to register the "ogf" namespace


  		





  
  371
  
    
   identifier (NID) at the URN Namespaces registry [URN-NAMESPACES] and


  		





  
  372
  
    
   refer to this document and/or the website http://www.ogf.org/urn/.


  		





  
  373
  
    

  		





  
  374
  
    

  		





  
  375
  
    
8.  Acknowledgements


  		





  
  376
  
    

  		





  
  377
  
    
   The authors like to thank Joel Replogle for helping set up the


  		





  
  378
  
    
   urn:ogf registry.  The template and useful examples from [RFC3406]


  		





  
  379
  
    
   formed the basis of this document.


  		





  
  380
  
    

  		





  
  381
  
    

  		





  
  382
  
    
9.  References


  		





  
  383
  
    

  		





  
  384
  
    
9.1.  Normative References


  		





  
  385
  
    

  		





  
  386
  
    
   [RFC2119]  Bradner, S., "Key words for use in RFCs to Indicate


  		





  
  387
  
    
              Requirement Levels", BCP 14, RFC 2119, March 1997.


  		





  
  388
  
    

  		





  
  389
  
    

  		





  
  390
  
    

  		





  
  391
  
    
Dijkstra & Hughes-Jones   Expires May 12, 2011                  [Page 7]


  		





  
  392
  
    



  		





  
  393
  
    
Internet-Draft          URN Namespace for the OGF          November 2010


  		





  
  394
  
    

  		





  
  395
  
    

  		





  
  396
  
    
   [RFC2141]  Moats, R., "URN Syntax", RFC 2141, May 1997.


  		





  
  397
  
    

  		





  
  398
  
    
   [RFC5234]  Crocker, D. and P. Overell, "Augmented BNF for Syntax


  		





  
  399
  
    
              Specifications: ABNF", STD 68, RFC 5234, January 2008.


  		





  
  400
  
    

  		





  
  401
  
    
9.2.  Informative References


  		





  
  402
  
    

  		





  
  403
  
    
   [GFD-SERIES]


  		





  
  404
  
    
              Open Grid Forum, "OGF Document Series",


  		





  
  405
  
    
              <http://www.ogf.org/gf/docs/>.


  		





  
  406
  
    

  		





  
  407
  
    
   [RFC3406]  Daigle, L., van Gulik, D., Iannella, R., and P. Faltstrom,


  		





  
  408
  
    
              "Uniform Resource Names (URN) Namespace Definition


  		





  
  409
  
    
              Mechanisms", BCP 66, RFC 3406, October 2002.


  		





  
  410
  
    

  		





  
  411
  
    
   [URN-NAMESPACES]


  		





  
  412
  
    
              IANA, "Official IANA Registry of URN Namespaces",


  		





  
  413
  
    
              <http://www.iana.org/assignments/urn-namespaces/>.


  		





  
  414
  
    

  		





  
  415
  
    
   [URN-OGF]  Open Grid Forum, "URN:OGF Hierarchy Registry and


  		





  
  416
  
    
              Documentation", <http://www.ogf.org/urn/>.


  		





  
  417
  
    

  		





  
  418
  
    

  		





  
  419

  2
  
    
<!DOCTYPE rfc SYSTEM "rfc2629.dtd">


  		





  
  3
  
    
<?xml-stylesheet type='text/xsl' href='rfc2629.xslt' ?>


  		





  
  4
  
    

  		





  
  5
  
    
<!-- Use XML2RFC (http://xml.resource.org/) to parse this XML-formatted internet-draft. -->


  		





  
  6
  
    
<!-- Alternatively, use the rfc2629.xslt stylesheet to convert this document to HTML:


  		





  
  7
  
    
     e.g. xsltproc draft-urn-ogf.xml > draft-urn-ogf.html -->


  		





  
  8
  
    

  		





  
  9
  
    
<?rfc toc="yes" ?>


  		





  
  10
  
    
<?rfc symrefs="yes" ?>


  		





  
  11
  
    
<?rfc sortrefs="yes"?>


  		





  
  12
  
    
<?rfc iprnotified="no" ?>  <!-- no known patent claims -->


  		





  
  13
  
    
<?rfc strict="yes" ?>


  		





  
  14
  
    
<?rfc compact="yes" ?>  <!-- reduce white space; don't start sections on new page -->


  		





  
  15
  
    
<?rfc subcompact="no" ?>  <!-- keep a blank link in lists -->


  		





  
  16
  
    
<?rfc comments="yes"?>  <!-- display the (cref) comments -->


  		





  
  17
  
    
<?rfc inline="yes" ?>  <!-- display comments inline -->


  		





  
  18
  
    

  		





  
  19
  
    
<rfc category="info" docName="draft-dijkstra-urn-ogf" ipr="trust200902" submissionType="independent">


  		





  
  20
  
    

  		





  
  21
  
    
  <front>


  		





  
  22
  
    

  		





  
  23
  
    
    <title abbrev="URN Namespace for the OGF">A URN Namespace for the Open Grid Forum (OGF)</title>


  		





  
  24
